H0.text: What is the maximum number of points that can be scored from a single shot in basketball. 1

H1.text: What is the maximum number of points that can be scored from a single shot in basketball. 2

H2.text: What is the maximum number of points that can be scored from a single shot in basketball. 4

H3.text: What is the maximum number of points that can be scored from a single shot in basketball. 3

A4.text: If a player completes a three-pointer while being fouled, the player is awarded one free-throw for a possible 4-point play.

A5.text: A successful basket is worth three points, in contrast to the two points awarded for field goals made within the three-point line.

A6.text: A successful shot is worth two points, or three points if it is taken from beyond the three-point arc.

A7.text: If a player is fouled while attempting a shot and the shot is successful, the player is awarded one additional free throw, which can result in a 'four-point play' when the shot is worth three points.

A8.text: This is known as a three-point or four-point play, depending on the value of the made basket.
